thread.title: Son of Patriots Special Teams coach gets into parade spirit
thread.title_full: Son of Patriots Special Teams coach gets into parade spirit - The Boston Globe

title: Son of Patriots Special Teams coach gets into parade spirit

organizations.name: barry chin/globe staff new england patriots

text:
Google+
By Jeremy C. Fox Globe Correspondent February 07, 2017
Tuesday morning was cold and snowy in Boston, but that didn’t stop many Patriots fans and players from celebrating the team’s Super Bowl LI victory without their parkas — or even their shirts.
Tight end Rob Gronkowski was characteristcally eccentric atop a duck boat Tuesday, shirtless and holding up a couple of beers.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski held up beers during the New England Patriots parade.
Advertisement
Video of the Patriots’ parade through Boston also appeared to show the son of special teams coach Joe Judge celebrating shirtless while perched on his father’s shoulders.
Judge has two sons, Sean and Michael. A Patriots spokesman could not immediately confirm the identity of the boy in the parade.
Ok nevermind. Joe Judge's son won the parade. Calling it early pic.twitter.com/mkqJLwfObt
— Doug Kyed (@DougKyed) February 7, 2017 Even before the parade began, an unidentified fan was spotted on Boylston street without his shift, though others in a nearby group were dressed appropriately for the weather.
The images captured the excitement of many Patriots fans after the team’s dramatic come-from-behind victory on Sunday, in the Super Bowl’s first-ever overtime play.
John Tlumacki/Globe staff
A fan took his shirt off as he celebrated with a group on Boylston street.
And here’s some others:
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
Fans cheered on the Patriots.
Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
Bare-chested men cheered on the Patriots.
Barry Chin/Globe Staff
New England Patriots fans show their support.
Advertisement
Let’s hope everyone got a chance to warm up quickly.
